titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Frank Barbaro Papers WAG.121
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-07-06T17:36-0400

change.item: Edited by Heather Mulliner to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Frank Barbaro was born in Brooklyn in 1927. A leftist and former longshoreman, he was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1972 and served for 26 years. As chairman of the Labor Committee, Barbaro was dedicated to advancing workers' protection laws. After leaving the Assembly, he served on the New York State Supreme Court for six years. This unprocessed collection consists mostly of correspondence and hearing transcripts from Frank Barbaro's service in the New York State Assembly (1976-1996). There is also material on specific legislation and events, nearly all of it labor related.
did.physloc: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection consists mostly of correspondence and hearing transcripts from Frank Barbaro's service in the New York State Assembly (1976-1996). There is also material on specific legislation and events, nearly all of it labor related.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Frank Barbaro was born in Brooklyn in 1927. A leftist and former longshoreman, he was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1972 and served for 26 years. As chairman of the Labor Committee, Barbaro was dedicated to advancing workers' protection laws. After leaving the Assembly, he served on the New York State Supreme Court for six years.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Frank Barbaro are held by Frank Barbaro. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Frank Barbaro.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Frank Barbaro Papers; WAG 121; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Frank Barbaro sent a gift of his papers in 1997. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.053.
